did.unittitle: Richard Beverly and Louis Wimpelberg power of attorney document
did.abstract: One 1866 power of attorney document appointing Louis Wimpelberg the attorney of Richard Beverly, and granting Wimpelberg the power in Beverly's stead to collect from Reuben Case of Brooklyn, N.Y. all money that may be due Beverly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Beverly and Louis Wimpelberg power of attorney document, 1866, 1977.508, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Power of attorney document appointing Louis Wimpelberg the attorney of Richard Beverly, and granting Wimpelberg the power in Beverly's stead to collect from Reuben Case of Brooklyn, N.Y. all money that may be due Beverly for the taking of the "Mobile" (meaning Mobile Bay, AL) by the U.S.S. Lackawanna during the Civil War. The document is dated January 4, 1866.
